title: Your two highest mastery point champions swap passives
body: They become stronger or weaker? Or maybe more interesting?

replies.body: omg could you fucking imagine walking into lane and farming and just minding your own business then you get max sion q and he just appears from the middle of lane and beats the living hell out of you, all the sudden league becomes a horror game hoping sion doesnt appear from thin air and destroys you,
Sion would literally become Jason.
Imagine getting ulted by an invisible Sion. You walk into a lane, all you hear is "DIEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE" and Sion appears out of nowhere. Holy fuck.
This is, by far, the best one so far.

{{champion:161}} and {{champion:202}} 

I have bad news for Jhin....and Vel....
Lol this is hilarious, Jhin would have a 3 hit passive....  I think Jhin would be more upset than Vel

Well, {{champion:240}} is absolutely garbage without Skaarl, as it turns out.
{{champion:412}} with an immortal lizard, though? Sounds f**king awesome!!

{{champion:24}} and {{champion:11}} 

Not much of a difference tbh
{{champion:21}} {{champion:99}}  . . . nothing's happening, am I doing it right?
Warwick with Annie's passive would be cool! :D He would be very strong with two ways of stun. Passive and ult. XD

But you HAVE to use your Q to get it. Stunning with Fear kind of =\ works but not perfect chaining. Stunning with Ult is just dumb.

I mean, it would add more skill expression to him. But he needs his current passive. If that was just added to it though, total plus.

MAYBE, (xx, Fear, Ult....Nah) I was thinking maybe if you Ult into a whole group and Fear(Stun), but since you have to cast fear first, the current Annie passive would only stun the one guy.

{{champion:40}} {{champion:111}} 
Janna definitely gets the better end of the deal. Not so much for Nautilus.

Kayn and Kindred


Uhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh I don't know what this means for either of them.

For Kayn, I guess maybe longer W range, increasing AS bonus after Q, and... more MS in wall during E? I think that's not terrible.

For Kindred... I guess either Lamb or Wolf can take over.
Kindred finally become the dual champ we always wanted
You sir play a fun champset

{{champion:35}} {{champion:6}} 

Would Shaco's clone get shotgun knees too?

Because I'd totally be down for that.

Urgot, on the other hand, goes back to being trash tier. RIP

{{champion:77}} {{champion:17}}  No, please god no. 

Invisible tank in your jungle who can ORA you to death with a attack speed stacked badger following behind.
The real question is, why is Aatrox your second highest mastery?

Honestly, I don't really know why I like him so much.  I don't play him anymore really.  I actually do pretty good with him, but I think most of that is just because nobody knows how to play against him since hes so rarely seen.  It honestly just feels really good to be good with something that most people find trash and to do well with it.  I enjoy finding strengths in things that don't seem to have any at first glance.  When they changed his passive back in march, I pretty much stopped playing him until recently.
same he was my second at the beginning of this season before his rework.
{{champion:86}} {{champion:3}} . Garen gets weaker, as his passive is essentially all his sustain. Galio get's stronger, because he gains sustain and can control his pushing better.

{{champion:41}} {{champion:89}}  Leona gets to deal a bunch of true damage every 12 seconds 

BUT, now when Gangplank ults PRAAAISE THE SUN {{item:3902}} {{item:3903}} {{item:3901}}
Veigar politely donates his infinite power to Kassadin in order to unleash true horror on the world {{sticker:sg-syndra}} {{sticker:sg-jinx}}
Veigar is getting the short end of the stick i feel

{{champion:117}} and {{champion:61}} 
Well, i'd trade more powerful Autos vs more powerful Autos... Nice! :D Guess Lulu would be stronger and Ori weaker tho.
the mana costs tho.

Taric with MF's passive destroys Taric. Way too weak.

MF with Taric's passive is a meme. Q enables taric's passive then procs it twice if it bounces, so infinite uptime. W reduces cooldown whenever you proc your passive, so infinite uptime. E doesn't change. R doesn't change.

Sej and Thresh...
Sej gains armor and AP from souls

Thresh has bonus armor/mr when out of combat

I'd welcome both of these changes tbh
{{champion:51}}  and  {{champion:28}}  look out twitch, there's a new invisible adc around.
Evelynn with headshot lul
Plot twist: Soraka healing a teammate at four stacks stuns them.
Her ult becomes a team wide stun. Except it's your team, not theirs : ^)

Warwick with Rengars Bush leap passive

Rengar with lifesteal while under 50% hp, as well as increased attack speed

{{champion:412}} {{champion:41}} Thresh gets to apply a true damage burn though he can't refresh it and GP gets infinite armor and AP which means he's tankier and heals more and gets more ult damage. I think they are both happy.

{{champion:157}}  and {{champion:17}}

{{champion:17}} laughs in 100% crit with two items

{{champion:136}}  and {{champion:157}} 

So Aurelion Sol gets a shield for moving. Not bad since he gets tons of movespeed, but the star loss...well he's not really a Star Dragon anymore. What would his W do? Also the crit chance...uh...Crit chance Sol build?

Yasuo gets stars. That makes his dashes even more annoying but not much else. 

So let's try {{champion:157}} and {{champion:202}}  instead.

Jhin now gets a shield and double crit chance (oh dear fuck) but since whisper is tied to his passive  he gets a lot weaker I think. He also doesn't need to reload, I guess?

Yasuo now throws his sword up to four times before he leaves it and pulls a new one out of his ass, with the fourth throw dealing bonus execute damage??? He also now is a psychopath, is obsessed with the number 4, gets bonus AD and MS from AS and crits...yay...?

{{champion:161}} and{{champion:127}} 

Hmmmmm true damage stun......
{{champion:45}} {{champion:90}} . Malzahar with Veigar passive? He would finally get back the damage stolen from him with the MYMU :P.

{{champion:111}} and {{champion:254}}.

{{champion:254}} gets a root any time she decks someone.  Neat.

{{champion:111}} gets more shields and becomes even harder to kill at the cost of a bit of CC.

Yeah, I'd take it.

{{champion:420}}  and {{champion:75}} 

Nasus is trash now.

Illaoi would be interesting, she could still get tentacles with ult, ad bonus lifesteal on her would fit well.

She would have to be more W focused, probably would max it.

{{champion:61}} Now throws {{champion:498}} Feathers. No way to recall them, but you know, cool i guess. Or Xayah does bonus per auto based on ap, with a three hit dmg buff. I guess that one's pretty cool.
